page.title: 11Eyebrook Reservoir
page.content: This reservoir,fed by the Eye Brook which rises to the North West, was constructed between 1936 and 1940 It was used by the steelworks in Corby which required 8 million gallons per day.Today only 1.6million is needed with the recent demise of the works.On average 670.5mm of precipitation falls over the catchment area annually.The average water depth in the reservoir is 5.3m,rising to 12.8m at the dam.The dam,constructed of concrete blocks and clay is 517m long,90m broad at the base and 4.6m at the top.At times waves up to 4m high pound against the wall.Siphons drain the water from the reservoir when the level rises above maximum. Normally the water flows to the pumping station at Caldecott to be pumped to Rockingham then Corby.
